isis.stitle: CAB: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - KEY SWITCH CYLINDER

svcprocinfo.para: The door locks and the ignition key switch are coded the same so that one key will operate both cylinders. The code number is stamped on the key switch body just in back of the cap nut. The code number does not appear on the door lock assembly.

step1.para: Unscrew the mounting cap nut from the key switch. Use the key to turn the cylinder until the key lines up with the slot in the screw threads (now exposed). Remove the key.
Insert a 1/16 inch (1.6 mm) diameter rod into the slot and in the screw threads, then depress the cylinder retainer ( Figure 10). Pull the cylinder approximately 1/8 inch (3 mm) from the switch body.
Replace the key into the slot. Use it to pull the complete cylinder from the switch body ( Figure 11).

figure.caption: Figure 11. Pull Cylinder From Switch Body

note.para: If vehicle keys are lost, drill out the switch cylinder. Use a 5/16 inch (8 mm) drill bit to drill 1/2 to 3/4 inch (12.7 to 19 mm) deep. This will permit the tumblers to drop out and free the switch cylinder.

svcsubproc.title: Install
svcsubproc.para: If the original key is desired when replacing the key switch cylinder, code the new key switch accordingly. Use the following steps:

step1.para: Insert original key in the new key switch cylinder (before insertion into the switch body) ( Figure 11). File off the tumblers that protrude from the cylinder. Make certain that no burrs are left on the tumblers and that all filings are blown out with compressed air.

To re-install the same cylinder or to install a new cylinder, apply a small quantity of powdered graphite to the tumblers, then insert cylinder back into the key switch body ( Figure 11). Turn the key to the ON position, or until the cylinder retainer ( Figure 10) snaps into place. Screw the mounting cap nut onto the key switch.
